The 78-year-old founder of the now-defunct Apple Daily, a newspaper known for critical reports against both the Hong Kong and Beijing governments, was sentenced to 20 years in prison Monday for his conviction under a China-imposed national security law. Here are 10 key moments in Laiâ€™s life showing his evolution from a clothing businessman to one of the cityâ€™s best-known pro-democracy activists. 1989: Tiananmen shifts path of clothing chain founder From a child laborer in a glove factory, Lai transformed himself into a clothing entrepreneur, founding the Giordano casual clothing chain in 1981.
